p: Developmental exposure to the UOG chemical mixture was associated with altered spontaneous activity in both the light and dark cycles in females. In the dark cycle, spontaneous activity was 27% lower in the 150 μg/kg/day treatment group relative to vehicle ( Figure 4A). In the light cycle, spontaneous activity was 34% lower in the 1,500 μg/kg/day treatment group relative to vehicle ( Figure 4B). No differences were detected in ambulatory, rearing activity, or meters traveled for any treatment group relative to vehicle in the light or the dark cycles ( Supplementary Figure 3).
